H0.text: Rotation of the moon is the repeating cycle responsible for the four seasons that occur on Earth.

H1.text: Rotation of the Sun is the repeating cycle responsible for the four seasons that occur on Earth.

H2.text: The revolution of the sun in the galaxy is the repeating cycle responsible for the four seasons that occur on Earth.

H3.text: The revolution of the earth about the sun is the repeating cycle responsible for the four seasons that occur on Earth.

A4.text: By astronomical convention, the four seasons are determined by the solstices and the equinoxes.

A5.text: The changing Earth-Sun distance results in an increase of about 7% in total solar energy reaching the Earth at perihelion relative to aphelion.
